result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • William P. KOHLMAN was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Count 1, OWI 3rd offense - No contest plea to amended charge.  Convicted.  $700.00 fine plus costs, total $1,870.00 to be paid by 05-17-17 or 37 days jail for failure to pay.  Alcohol Assessment.  Twenty-six (26) month license revocation.  Ignition interlock for period of revocation.  Fifty (50) days Manitowoc County Jail, Huber Law, commencing immediately.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.
Count 2, P.A.C. 3rd offense, is dismissed and read in on the State's motion.
Minutes.
Amended Information filed amending Count 1 to a straight operating while intoxicated, 3rd offense.

Minutes.
RE:  OWI - 3rd offense, on 09-24-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI - 2nd offense with minor passenger in vehicle.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-09-15 at 9:30 a.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid license and maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol or any kind at any time. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
